alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 6:00PM EDT until June 10 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stuart, Indiantown, Jupiter Island, Palm City, Port Salerno, Jensen Beach, Hobe Sound, Sewall`s Point, North River Shores, Witham Field, Hobe Sound Beach, Jonathan Dickinson State Park, Ocean Breeze Park, Rio and Hobe Sound Wildlife Refuge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
